member.name: M:Enterprise.Testing.AspNetCore.Services.HttpContextCreationService.CreateDefaultContext
member.summary: Use this when you need an HttpContext instance, but you don't need to change any of its read-only properties. Some of the read-only properties include the features collection, connection, http request and response objects, etc. In the case that you do need to change these, use NSubstitute for mocking an HttpContext instance.
